title: Area/Volume: trig and exp curves part - a

content.description: Let F and g be the functions given by  <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@448D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and g(x) = 4-x. Let R be the shaded region in the first quadrant enclosed by the y-axis and the graphs of f and g, and let S be the shaded region in the first quadrant enclosed by the graphs of f and g, as shown in the figure above.
content.question: Find the area of R.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Use appropriate mathematical symbols and notation (e.g., Represent a derivative using ƒ'(x), y', and dy/dx).
